group_1.textRight: You're right...at the time, I was lying...
I didn't want you to worry about me...
That's why I stopped sending messages...@It was too painful to keep lying to you...

group_1.narration: Jun's absence was so painful that I@started to shut myself away again...
I'm sure Jun was the one who took the reins@and pulled me along...@And I was glad to be pulled along,@because I would've been helpless to do anything on my own...
So, I couldn't do anything anymore...
Once again,@my days became filled with nothing but frustration and@immersing myself in the Internet...
It was even worse than the time I was a shut-in before,@because there was now the grief from losing Jun...
But, I still persevered and tried my best...

group_1.textCenter: ...O-okay, I made it out here on my own...@It's been a while since I've been outside...

group_1.textRight: Will you form a contract with me and@become a Magical Girl?

group_1.textCenter: (That creature...was the one with Jun before...!)

group_1.textLeft: Because...I won't become a Magical Girl...!

group_1.textCenter: (I promised Jun...that I wouldn't become a@Magical Girl...)

group_1.narration: Jun told me I'd be okay.@I believed her, and tried my hardest...
I was desperate...@It'd been over a year and a half since then...
I was more torn by Jun's absence than by my own seclusion.@It was unbearably painful not being able to see the person@I aspired to be.
That's why,@I decided to personally tarnish my memories of Jun,@who had saved my life so many times,@with my own wish...
That way,@I could live quietly without getting involved with anyone.
As a Magical Girl, I was forced to go outside...
